subject: Luge Racing
lead_paragraph: The three-time defending champion Armin Zöeggeler won the first men’s World Cup luge race of the season, in Lake Placid, N.Y. Zöeggeler turned in the fastest times in each of the two heats for a combined time of 1:45.238.
snippet: The three-time defending champion Armin Zöeggeler won the first men’s World Cup luge race of the season, in Lake Placid, N.Y. Zöeggeler turned in the fastest times in each of the two heats for a combined time of 1:45.238.
